Returns: x to the power of y.
pow(float, float).Description: Returns the closest float approximation of the result of raising x to the power of y.
pow(float, float).FullName: public static float pow (float x, float y)

floor(float).Description: Returns the float conversion of the most positive (i.e. closest to positive infinity) integer value which is less than the argument.

Parameters: to compute the cosine of, in radians
cos(float).Description: Returns the closest float approximation of the cosine of the argument.

Parameters: to compute the cosine of, in radians
sin(float).Description: Returns the closest float approximation of the sine of the argument.

sqrt(float).Description: Returns the closest float approximation of the square root of the argument.

ceil(float).Description: Returns the float conversion of the most negative (i.e. closest to negative infinity) integer value which is greater than the argument.

exp(float).Description: Returns the closest float approximation of the raising "e" to the power of the argument.

hypot(float, float).FullName: public static float hypot (float x, float y)

ClassDesc: Use @B_java#lang#Math_E@ instead. Math routines similar to those found in @B_java#lang#Math_E@. Historically these methods were faster than the equivalent double-based @B_java#lang#Math_E@ methods. On versions of Android with a JIT they became slower and have since been re-implemented to wrap calls to @B_java#lang#Math_E@. @B_java#lang#Math_E@ should be used in preference. All methods were removed from the public API in version 23.
